author: Sentinel Digital Desk
title: Assam: RSS Chief Expresses Happiness over Treaty with ULFA - Sentinelassam
text: Assam: RSS Chief Expresses Happiness over Treaty with ULFA A meeting took place at the Keshab Bhawan from 9 AM to around 9:45 AM on Saturday morning in the presence of several leaders. DIBRUGARH: Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh (RSS) chief Mohan Bhagwat who is currently in Assam, expressed happiness over the recent developments regarding the signing of a treaty with the United Liberation Front of Assam. Mohan Bhagwat, head of the [Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh](https://www.sentinelassam.com/north-east-india-news/arunachal-news/security-forces-apprehend-ulfa-i-nscn-k-ya-rebels-in-arunachal-pradesh-629337) is on a visit to Assam. After a peace treaty was signed between the government and the United Liberation Front of Assam on Friday, a meeting was organised at the head office of the Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh in Dibrugarh. This meeting took place at the Keshab Bhawan from 9 AM to around 9:45 AM on Saturday morning. This meeting was attended by several key leaders including the Union Minster of Ports, Shipping and Waterways and AYUSH for the Government of India. The principal of the Assam Medical College Dr Prasanta Kumar Dihingia also attended this event. After this meeting, a senior member conveyed the opinions of the chief to the members of the media present at the Keshab Bhawan. He mentioned that this is a very positive step, which will encourage the growth of the state of Assam. Soon after the meeting, the head of the Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh moved towards the Dibrugarh airport from where he was scheduled to travel to Kolkata. He had reached Dibrugarh late on Friday after attending a meeting of the organisation in Majuli. Addressing the Luit Subansiri Samavesh organized by the RSS’ Majuli unit on Friday, Bhagwat said, “We have to develop our nation on the basis of Bharat’s time-tested selfhood.” He questioned the audience: despite achieving her hard-earned independence, had Bharat been able to retain the “Swa” or selfhood, in it? “Also, a pertinent question is valid forever: without patriotism and unity among ourselves, long-lasting independence will be at stake. The main reason behind the formation of the RSS is to awaken our society towards making it patriotic and organized.” Also Read: [Assam: Peace accord signed with United Liberation Front of Asom (ULFA) ](https://www.sentinelassam.com/topheadlines/assam-peace-accord-signed-with-united-liberation-front-of-asom-ulfa-683784#google_vignette) Also Watch:

author: world today news
title: Oral-B iO Series 7 Smart Electric Toothbrush Drops to $149 on Amazon with $71 Discount - World Today News
text: This topic was written by Sultan Al-Qahtani – The price of the Oral-B iO Series 7 smart electric toothbrush has dropped to $149 on the Amazon store after a $71 discount. This deal comes as part of a larger sale that includes a 55 percent discount on Oral-B toothbrushes. The iO Series 7 is a top pick for smart toothbrushes because it strikes a good balance between features and affordability, especially if you can get it at the current price. The toothbrush has a black and white LED display that tells you useful information such as mode, battery life, and how much time is left on the two-minute timer. The brush head comes with strong vibration, but it does not cause numbness to the lips like other smart toothbrushes. The illuminated ring also indicates whether you are pressing too hard or not hard enough. If you want to brush your teeth while looking at your phone, you can watch an entertainment animation of a set of teeth slowly turning from blue to white as internal sensors track the brush’s position and movement. The brush comes with a replacement head, case and charging base which you should only need to use twice a month. Source

author: Press Release
title: Samuel Dixon Awarded 1.1 Million Grant for SUD Program
text:
Samuel Dixon Family Health Center, Inc. has announced that it was awarded a $1.1 million grant from the Department of Health and Human Services Health Resources and Services Administration to add new services that will include substance use disorder treatment programs.
This funding will support innovative approaches aimed at improving access to care, expanding treatment services, and promoting recovery in our community.
Substance use disorder remains a significant public health challenge, impacting individuals and families in our communities. With this grant, Samuel Dixon Family Health Center will implement evidence-based practices that focus on comprehensive treatment, including counseling, medication support and tailored services to meet the unique needs of those affected by substance use disorder.
“The Board of Directors is incredibly grateful to receive this grant, which will enable us to enhance our efforts in providing essential substance use disorder treatment. Adding these essential services reaffirms our commitment to supporting individuals on their path to recovery.” said Gloria Mercado-Fortine, Chairperson of the Board of Directors.
In addition to primary care, pediatrics and oral health care services, Samuel Dixon Family Health Center offers counseling and support services at their two behavioral health locations in Newhall and Valencia. The substance use disorder programs that are supported by this grant will be offered at their Valencia location which is currently being expanded and remodeled to accommodate these services.
“This funding will enable us to expand our reach and provide critical resources to individuals struggling with substance use disorder. Our goal is to not only treat addiction but to foster long-term recovery and wellness,” said Amanda Hills, Clinical Director.
The initiatives funded by the grant include increasing availability of treatment services to underserved populations through outreach and community partnership, integrating mental health services and wellness programs to address the multifaceted nature of substance use disorders and providing ongoing training for staff to ensure they are equipped with the latest knowledge and skills in addiction treatment.
“This grant represents a significant investment in the health and well-being of our community and our efforts to address the complexities of substance use disorders with compassion and expertise,” said Philip Solomon, CEO. “Together, we can foster healthier communities and provide hope to those in need.”
For more information about Samuel Dixon Family Health Center, Inc. and its programs, please visit www.sdfhc.org .
